units.name: Bastion
units.prompt: Push forward aggressively. Shield_wall facing the enemy cluster. If flanked, turn to face the biggest threat. Attack when possible.

units.name: Deadeye
units.prompt: Position for clear sight lines. Prioritize killing wounded enemies with precision_shot. If forced to move, retreat away from threats. Suppressing_fire to slow rushers.

units.name: Grid
units.prompt: Place traps on tiles enemies are likely to move through. Use pulse if 2+ enemies are adjacent. Stay near allies for mutual support.

units.name: Seer
units.prompt: Scan early to give your team intel on enemy prompts. Target enemy specters with scan to track them after cloak. Use recalibrate on allies who need tactical adjustments. Stay safe at range behind your front line.

units.name: Bulwark
units.prompt: Push forward aggressively. Shield_wall facing the enemy cluster. If flanked, turn to face the biggest threat. Attack when possible.

units.name: Viper
units.prompt: Trap the paths enemies must take to reach your backline. Stay at medium range. Use pulse on clustered enemies. Denial blocks adjacent threats.

actions.thinking: All enemies are out of scan range (dist 5-9, need ≤4). I should advance to bring Deadeye into scan range. Moving to (4,2) reduces dist to Deadeye to 2, enabling scan next turn. Stay behind front line.

Seer is closest at dist=2 and already acted this round. I can precision_shot Seer from current position without moving (no adjacent enemies, so High Ground passive applies giving rng4). Seer is at dist=2, within range. After shooting, I can move to (3,2) to maintain distance from threats while keeping sight lines open.

Push forward toward the enemy cluster. Seer is at (4,2) dist=4, Bulwark at (3,4) dist=5. Move to (2,2) to advance while staying central. Then shield_wall facing North toward the enemy cluster to protect allies and absorb incoming fire.

Round 1, no enemies in range. Enemies (Deadeye at 3,2 and Bastion at 2,2) will advance toward our backline. I should move forward and place a trap on a likely approach path. Moving to (5,2) gets me closer while staying safe. Then I'll trap (4,2) or (3,3) — key chokepoint tiles enemies must pass through to reach our backline. Seer is at (4,2) so I'll trap (3,3) which is a natural approach path.

All enemies are far away (dist 6-7). I should advance toward the center and place a trap on a likely approach path. Moving to (1,1) puts me closer to allies and the center. Then place a trap at (2,2) or along enemy approach routes. Enemies are likely to push through the center, so placing a trap at (2,1) or (1,2) makes sense as a chokepoint.

Push forward aggressively per orders. Move from (3,4) to (3,3) to close distance with Deadeye at (3,2) — puts me adjacent next turn. Note trap at (4,3), avoid it. Deadeye is directly south of me at dist=2, Bastion at (2,2). After moving to (3,3), I'm 1 tile from Deadeye but still not adjacent (dist=1, need adjacent for attack). Shield_wall facing S toward the enemy cluster to protect allies Seer and Viper behind me.

Deadeye is at dist=1 and used precision_shot on me last turn — highest threat. Scan Deadeye first to deal 1 damage and reveal their prompt. Then move to (4,4) to increase distance from Deadeye and Bastion while staying behind Bulwark at (3,3). Avoid (4,3) trap.

I'm at 1HP — critical priority is survival. Bulwark is adjacent at (3,3) threatening me. Viper at (5,2) is 2 tiles away. If I stay, I'm likely dead. I need to retreat. Moving to (3,0) puts maximum distance from Bulwark and Viper while staying on the field. From there I can't reach enemies this turn but I survive. Alternatively, I could use suppressing_fire on Viper before retreating to slow their approach. Fire first at Viper to slow them, then retreat south.

Bastion is at (2,2), dist=2. Moving to (2,3) puts me adjacent to Bastion for a melee attack. Orders say push forward aggressively and attack when possible. (2,3) is a valid move tile. From (2,3) Bastion at (2,2) is adjacent (dist=1). I'll move to (2,3) then attack Bastion. No trap at (2,3). Shield_wall not needed when I can attack directly.

Bulwark is adjacent at (2,3) — attack it. I'm fortified so staying put maintains 50% DR. After attacking, use shield_wall facing North to protect against Bulwark's likely counterattack from that direction.

No enemies in range. Bulwark at (2,3) is closest at dist 3, moving NW. I should move to intercept and place a trap on a likely enemy path. Moving to (1,3) closes distance to Bulwark and puts me in position. Then place trap at (2,2) - but that's where Bastion is. Place trap at (1,2) as a chokepoint between me and Bulwark's likely advance. Actually, move to (1,3) first, then trap at (2,3) to catch Bulwark or block their path. Wait - trap requires empty tile. (2,3) is Bulwark's current position, not empty. Trap at (3,2) is out of range from (1,3) (dist=2, valid). Moving to (1,3) first then trapping (3,2) covers the approach lane between enemies.

Suppressed so movement reduced to 1. No enemies in range from current position. I should move toward enemies to eventually get in range, while laying a trap on a likely approach path. The trap at (4,3) is already placed. Enemies are approaching from the west/southwest. Moving to (4,2) gets me closer and I can place a trap at (5,3) or nearby to cover the eastern flank. Actually, moving to (5,1) puts me closer to Deadeye who is critical at (3,0). I can place a trap at (4,1) to intercept Deadeye's path, or trap at (4,2) as a chokepoint. Let me move to (4,2) to reposition closer to action, then place a trap at (3,2) to block the corridor - but wait, trap range is ≤2 tiles. From (4,2) I can reach (3,2), (2,2) is 2 tiles, (4,4) is 2 tiles. Place trap at (3,2) to intercept Bastion moving east, or (4,1) to intercept Deadeye. I'll move to (4,2) then trap (3,2) - a likely approach path for Bastion.

Grid placed a trap at (2,4) last turn and is at (1,3). I should scan Grid to reveal their prompt and deal damage. I already know Deadeye's prompt. Bastion is also in range but Grid is the more dangerous denial threat near our team. Scan Grid, then move to maintain safe distance.

I'm at 1HP and critically low. Viper is exactly 3 tiles away at (4,2) and in range for precision_shot. I'm not adjacent to Viper so precision_shot isn't blocked. I should shoot Viper now before moving, since moving would reduce precision_shot to 1dmg. After shooting, I need to retreat away from threats — moving to (5,0) puts distance between me and Viper/Bulwark.

I'm at (4,2) with 3HP, moving west. Bastion is adjacent at dist=2. Traps already at (4,3) and (3,2). I should place a trap to block enemy approach paths and maintain pressure. Moving to (3,1) would let me place a trap at a key chokepoint. Alternatively, I can trap (3,3) to funnel enemies. Since Bastion is at (2,2) and approaching, I want to trap tiles they'll cross. (3,2) already trapped. Let me move to (4,1) to stay safe and place a trap at (3,1) to block the southern approach corridor.

Bulwark is adjacent at (2,3) - I can attack it. I'm at half HP so I need to be careful. Trap at (2,4) already exists. I should attack Bulwark since it's in range, then consider repositioning. My Denial passive is already suppressing Bulwark's abilities since it's adjacent. Attack Bulwark for 1 damage, then move away to (0,3) to create distance and avoid being surrounded.

Bastion is adjacent at (2,2) to my south — I can attack immediately. I'm fortified (50% DR) so staying put is ideal. Grid is 2 tiles west, so I must not move toward it. Attack Bastion, then shield_wall facing south to block further attacks from that direction while keeping fortify.

Bulwark is adjacent at (2,3) to my north. I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction. Orders say push forward and attack when possible. I can attack Bulwark directly. After attacking, I'll shield_wall facing North (toward Bulwark and the enemy cluster) to protect myself and nearby allies.

Deadeye is at critical HP and within scan range (dist=4). I already have their prompt, so scanning again would be redundant. Better to use scan to deal 1 damage — Deadeye is critical so this might finish them or weaken further. Stay at current position to maintain range advantage and avoid moving into traps at (4,3).

I'm at (4,1) with 3/6 HP, wounded. Bastion is at (2,2) heading N, dist 3. Traps already at (4,3), (3,2), (3,1). Bastion moving north will likely approach through the center. I should move to (3,0) or stay and place a trap to cover approach paths. Moving to (3,2) is blocked by existing trap. I can move to (4,2) and place a trap at (3,0) to cover southern approach, or move to (5,1) to stay safe at range. Best play: move to (5,1) to maintain distance and safety, then trap (4,2) to block Bastion's path toward our backline at (5,4).

Bastion is adjacent at (2,2) to my south — I can attack immediately. I'm fortified (50% DR) and should stay put to keep that bonus. Attack Bastion, then use shield_wall facing South to protect against further hits from that direction. Grid is 2 tiles away so no adjacent threat yet.

Bulwark is adjacent at (2,3) — attack immediately. I'm fortified so I shouldn't move (lose 50% DR). Grid is at (0,3) to my west and wounded — shield_wall facing N covers Bulwark direction but orders say face enemy cluster. Bulwark is directly north, Viper is far east. Attack Bulwark first, then shield_wall facing N to block Bulwark's return attack and protect the line.

I'm at (0,3) with 3/6 HP. Bulwark is at (2,3) distance 2 - within my trap range. I have traps at (2,1) and (2,4) already placed. Bulwark is healthy and close. I can't place a trap adjacent to an enemy (denial blocks trap if adjacent, and Bulwark at dist 2 is not adjacent). I should place a trap on a tile Bulwark might move through. Bulwark is at (2,3) facing W - likely moving toward me. Tile (1,3) is between us and a good trap location. Then I'll move to (1,3) after placing trap... wait, I'd be stepping on my own trap. Better: move to (1,4) first to reposition, then place trap at (1,3) which is on the path between me and Bulwark. Actually, place trap first at (1,3) then move away to (0,4). Trap at (1,3) is within 2 tiles of current position (0,3) - distance is 1, valid. Then move to (0,2) or stay. Let me place trap at (1,3) first, then move to (0,4) to maintain distance from Bulwark.

Both enemies are out of scan range (dist=5 > 4). Grid is already scanned and wounded at (0,4), far left. Bastion is at (2,2) healthy, also out of range. Bulwark is adjacent to Bastion and will attack/shield_wall. My best move is to close distance toward Bastion to get scan range next turn. Moving to (3,4) gets me closer (dist to Bastion would be ~2, well in range). Viper is at (5,1) wounded — I could recalibrate but they're not adjacent. I'll move toward center to get Bastion in scan range next turn. Move to (3,4) brings Bastion to dist=√(1+4)≈2.2, well within range 4. Then wait since no valid targets in range.

Both enemies are out of range and far away. Bastion at (2,2) is dist 4 - approaching from the west. Grid at (0,4) is dist 8 and wounded. My traps at (4,3),(3,2),(3,1),(4,2) already cover the middle approaches. Bastion will likely move toward our backline. I should move to (4,1) to get closer to Bastion while staying at medium range, then place a trap at (3,1) — wait, (3,1) already has a trap. Let me place one at (4,0) or stay and trap a new approach tile. Moving to (4,2) would be on a trap. Move to (4,1) then trap (3,0) to cover the southern approach path Bastion might use.
Bastion is adjacent at (2,2) — I should attack. I'm fortified so I don't want to move. Stay put, attack Bastion, then shield_wall facing S to protect against Bastion's attacks.

Bulwark is adjacent at (2,3) — attack it. I'm fortified so I keep 50% damage reduction if I don't move. Staying put and attacking Bulwark is optimal. Use shield_wall facing North to cover against Seer/Bulwark cluster direction after attacking.

I'm at (0,4) with 3HP, wounded. Bulwark is at (2,3) and Seer at (3,4), both dist=3. Trap at (2,4) already exists. I should move toward the action and place a trap on a likely enemy path. Moving to (1,4) gets me closer. From there I can place a trap at (2,4)... but that's already trapped. I should place a trap at (1,3) - wait, that's already trapped too. Let me check available trap spots. Traps exist at (2,1), (2,4), (1,3). Good paths for enemies moving toward our side: (1,5) or (2,4) already covered. Move to (1,4) first, then place trap at (1,5) to block northern approach, or move to (2,4) to block that area. Actually moving to (1,4) and placing trap at (1,5) creates a barrier. Seer at (3,4) moving west might go through (2,4)[trapped] or (1,4). If I move to (1,4), I'm on that path. Better: move to (1,5) and trap (2,5) to catch Seer moving north/west.

Bastion is healthy and in scan range at dist=3. I already know Grid's prompt. Priority: scan Bastion to reveal its prompt and deal damage. I'm at (3,4), Bastion at (2,2) — dist=3, within range 4. Grid is 3 tiles away so I'm not adjacent, scan is not blocked. After scanning, I can move to (4,4) to maintain safe distance from Grid.

I'm at (1,5) with 3/6 HP, wounded. No enemies in range. Bulwark is at (2,3) distance 3, moving toward us. Trap at (2,4) already exists. I should move to reposition and place a trap on a likely enemy approach path. (1,3) already has a trap. (2,5) already has a trap. I can move to (0,4) to avoid being on (2,4) trap, then place a trap on (3,5) or another approach tile. Actually, let me move toward supporting Bastion at (2,2) while placing traps. Moving to (1,4) keeps me mobile. Then place trap on (3,5) to cover eastern approach, or better - place on a tile Bulwark at (2,3) might step through. Bulwark is at (2,3) heading W - could move to (1,3) but that's trapped. Could move to (2,4) but that's trapped too. Let me place trap on (0,3) - not in valid move list but I can trap from current position if within range. From (1,5), (0,3) is distance 3 - out of trap range (≤2). From (1,5), I can trap tiles within 2: (0,3)-(2,3) area. Wait, trap range is ≤2 tiles. (2,3) is distance 3 from me - out of range. Let me move to (1,3) - already trapped. Move to (2,4) - already trapped. Move to (1,4), then trap (2,3) where Bulwark stands? Dist from (1,4) to (2,3) = 2, in range! That would place trap under Bulwark. Valid.

I'm at (4,1) with 3HP, acting as Viper. No enemies in range currently. Bastion is at (2,2) dist=3 and Grid at (1,4) dist=6. I have traps at (4,3),(3,2),(3,1),(4,2),(3,0) already placed. Bastion at (2,2) is wounded and approaching - it needs to pass through the area around (3,2) to reach our backline. That trap at (3,2) should catch it. I need to reposition to get Bastion in attack range or set up more denial. Moving to (2,1) puts me adjacent to Bastion at (2,2) - that would activate Denial on it and potentially let me attack. But at 3HP I need to be careful. Moving to (3,2) would be a trap tile - bad. Let me move to (2,1) to get adjacent to Bastion (dist=1 from 2,1 to 2,2), enabling Denial and an attack for 1 damage on the wounded Bastion. That's aggressive but Bastion is wounded. After moving to (2,1), I can attack Bastion at (2,2).

Bastion is adjacent at (2,2) — attack immediately. I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction, so staying put is beneficial. After attacking, use shield_wall facing South to protect allies from Bastion. Grid is 2 tiles away and a threat but not yet adjacent.

I'm at 3/11 HP, fortified, with Viper adjacent to the south (2,1) and Bulwark adjacent to the north (2,3). Denial zone blocks my abilities against Viper. I can attack Bulwark freely. Staying put preserves fortify and lets me attack. Attack Bulwark (wounded, to my north at 2,3) since denial blocks abilities vs Viper. Then shield_wall facing south to reduce damage from Viper cluster.

Both enemies already scanned — no new scan targets needed. Grid is at (1,4), 3 tiles away — must stay non-adjacent. Bastion is at (2,2), wounded and being pressured by Bulwark and Viper. I should recalibrate an ally to improve their effectiveness. Bulwark is adjacent at (2,3) — wounded sentinel who just used shield_wall facing S. I can recalibrate Bulwark to coordinate better. Move to (3,4) to stay safe and get adjacent to Bulwark for recalibrate, but (3,4) is valid and Bulwark is at (2,3) — that's diagonal, not adjacent. Let me check: Bulwark @(2,3), I'm at (3,4) — distance is sqrt(2), diagonally adjacent. Recalibrate requires adjacent only. From (4,4) Bulwark at (2,3) is distance 3, out of range. Move to (3,4) first: then Bulwark at (2,3) is 1 diagonal away — if adjacent means orthogonal only, that won't work. Move to (3,3): Bulwark at (2,3) is 1 tile west — orthogonally adjacent. From current (4,4), moving to (3,3) is valid (in move list). Then recalibrate Bulwark at (2,3). Good plan. Addendum: tell Bulwark to turn shield_wall North to protect against Bastion attacking from (2,2).

secondAction.addendum: Turn shield_wall to face North toward Bastion at (2,2). Hold position and absorb attacks while Viper flanks.

actions.thinking: I'm at 3/11 HP with Fortify active (50% DR). Viper is adjacent at (2,1) with DENIAL blocking my abilities — only basic attack works against it. Bulwark is at (2,3) also adjacent. Orders say push forward and attack. Viper is the immediate threat with DENIAL suppressing my abilities. I can attack Viper to deal damage while staying fortified. Then for second action, since DENIAL blocks abilities while adjacent to Viper, I should attack Bulwark or wait — but I can only use one attack per turn. Actually, I can attack Viper first, then the denial zone is still there if I stay. Better to attack Viper (wounded, closer threat causing DENIAL) and then wait to keep Fortify bonus since moving would lose it.

I'm at (1,4) with 3HP, wounded. Bulwark is at (2,3), distance 2, within trap range. My traps are at (2,4), (1,3), (2,5). Bulwark at (2,3) is wounded and adjacent to my trap at (2,4). I should place a trap on a likely movement path. Viper at (2,1) is critical and might move north toward our cluster. Tile (2,2) is where Bastion is, so Viper might move through (2,2) area. I can't trap (1,3) or (2,4) or (2,5) since those are already trapped. Valid moves include (3,4) which would bring me closer to Seer. I should place a trap on a path enemies might take - (1,2) could intercept Viper moving north-west. I'm at (1,4), so I can trap tiles within 2 tiles. Let me trap (1,2) to catch Viper if it moves north. Then I could move to maintain distance from Bulwark while staying near Bastion.

I'm fortified at (2,3) with Bastion adjacent at (2,2) to the south. Orders say shield_wall facing North toward Bastion, then attack. I should stay put to maintain fortify bonus (50% damage reduction), use shield_wall facing South toward Bastion to protect allies behind me, then attack Bastion who is adjacent.

I'm at (2,1) with 1HP - critically low. Bastion is adjacent at (2,2) and critical. I can attack Bastion to potentially finish it, but I need to survive. Moving away first then attacking isn't great since attack range is adjacent only. Best play: attack Bastion (it's critical, one hit might finish it), then move away from danger. (3,0) has a trap already. Move to (1,0) or (1,1) to escape. Let me attack first while adjacent, then flee south-west.
